title: What happened to the growth of Micromax India? - Quora

response.answer_text: There have been companies like Apple & Samsung that have been in this industry since long and have offered good products to consumers and have had a lion's share in the smartphone market over the years. Other chinese brands like Xiaomi, Oppo, Vivo, OnePlus, Huawei and others like Motorola and Nokia have come up with smart innovations and good business strategies to conquer a large part of the market. Other brands like Sony, HTC, LG and Blackberry have almost been wiped out of the market due to bad business models. But one thing is common between all the three tiers of brands specified above, is that each of them had a proper working R&D and invested a lot in creating new products, implementing new technologies, and improving upon previous generations. What micromax did and still does, is an utter disgrace. It blatantly picks any average smartphone from the hundreds easily available in the Chinese market, which takes almost nothing to manufacture, brings it to India, rebrands it, and sells them! As the capital investment is almost none but the buying price of the smartphones and importing them from China, they could price them at aggressively and therefore, had huge initial success in the Indian market, starting from the quarter 3 of 2013, as the population was not aware of all this, and in general, the smartphone industry was still growing, people were less knowledgeable about the technical parts of phones. Also Micromax gave the notion of “Made in India”, which also made those phones sell in India like hot cakes at a point of time, also being the largest seller of phones in India at a point of time when its only notable big competitor was Samsung, in the mid-range. Times changed, other brands arrived with better products, and Micromax had to fall. It was just inevitable. After all, these were the daddies of the street phones Micromax used to import from China and refurbish in India! :P

Micromax was over confident Micromax was once a great player on paper but sticking to the same strategy lead it to lose against Chinese players. Apparently, Micromax was not only a Phone Manufacturing company but was more like a Phone Trading company. They usually rebranded already released chinese phones and sold them in India after rebranding them. Even after a few years of great sales, they did not develop much R&D and did not do any innovation to win the trust of their buyers. Moreover, their after sales service was poor. Then came the Chinese players with many greater features, better camera, better on sheet specs. In short, value for money segment phones. Phones companies like Xiaomi and Oppo stormed the market with their non Stock looking UI, MIUI and Funtouch OS which many people seem to like. Moreover they were providing features no stock OS would provide. Slowly people changed their thoughts about Chinese phones. High End meant OnePlus, mid end got flooded with phones with better designs, beautiful looking phones. Features like metal frame became the standard when Micromax still provided phones with sub standard materials and features which feels like overpriced which once were a standard for their price segment. And now, Chinese players rule the Indian phone market.

Micromax was the largest manufacturer of devices in Indian cellphone market 2 years back leaving Samsung far behind. Also it was the 10th largest globally. Micromax built its huge market share and penetrated low value smartphone & cellphone market by getting its major cellphone components manufactured by Chinese companies like Gionee & Oppo. The Chinese soon realized the potential and brought out cheap smartphones under there own brand names. Indian players like Micromax, Karbonn, Intex are taking the hit. and so they are focusing more on exports market. Also the management situation at Micromax took a huge blow when new top level management was recruited last year. Of this management team 80% have already left the company including their Chief executive Officer. Alibaba was planning of buying a 20% stake last year but decided against it owing to Micromax's unclear growth strategy and vision.

It was unfortunate that a very successful Indian company like Micromax, has to go through this tough situation.  It isn't a single reason as to why Micromax was eventually run out by other smart phone companies. The company once plummeted their sales percentage with the help of some Chinese big time companies that manufactured Gionee, Vivo and so on, but later on, these companies are firmly established in India. Also, these Chinese companies spent Millions of dollars to advertise their brands and successfully corned the local market. With this, the local market of Micromax staggered. According to certain reports, the companies inability to get funds has also damaged their position in the market. While the companies CEO, Vineet Taneja, quit his position a couple of weeks ago, the companies instable leadership also effected their growth. I think, with the involvement of multi national companies in the Indian market and their attractive advertisements, Indian market is showing more interest in these foreign brands rather than our own companies.

Micromax failed in India, despite being a ‘Made In India’ company, it could not sustain itself for long. The primary reason for their decline is that the company hardly spent on Research and Development. Micromax launched its first smartphone in 2008 and was a massive success, however few years down the road, it started facing loses. Indian markets became flooded with Chinese smartphones such as Oppo, Vivo, Realme and Xiaomi. Micromax did not have the financial strength to compete with these brands. Further, Chinese companies were allowed to set up factories in India, this lead to another setback for Indian Smartphone maker Micromax. Initially Micromax came up with unique features such as a month long battery life, it even overtook Samsung’s sales in India. In 2016, Chinese brands, came up with better cameras and 4G, however Micromax was still continuing with its 3G model. Hence Micromax’s downfall was as swift as its meteoric rise. Nationalists did not come to its rescue when it experienced its downfall, however with PM Modi’s ‘Atmanirbhar Bharat’ announcement, things look bright for Micromax which may get a second life with this initiative, since Indians are boycotting Chinese goods. Do the the massive level of competition by brands such as MI ,one plus smasung lg and so on we tend to ignore the brands that are home grown. Micromax is still growing and is releasing new phones don't worry its just that it is not as flashy as it used to be. However it has launched 3-5 new devices this month and i think we will be seeing advertisements of those devices very soon so just be patient and hope for the best.
An army of top level Chinese Smartphone manufacturers kicked in with the best value for money products!

Being a Indian company Micromax had a good chance of making a mark by making in India scheme but they fooled people by making in China that too refurbished phones from other brands so lost its entire market. But they are doing a come back with Micromax Bharat go.

micromax as it given very good phone but it falls against the service center and spare parts non availability. Market of india flooded with high end mob devices once they noticed the growth of Micromax. but some reason micromax poor management was not able to handle its competitor.
